name: BLAS
description: Standard building blocks for performing basic vector and matrix operations.

name: OpenBLAS
description: Optimized BLAS library based on GotoBLAS2.

name: BLIS
description: High-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.

name: LAPACK
description: Routines for solving systems of linear equations, least-squares solutions of linear systems, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems.

name: Eigen
description: C++ template library for linear algebra.

name: PETSc
description: Data structures and routines for the parallel solution of scientific applications modeled by PDEs.

name: DUNE Numerics
description: Toolbox for solving PDEs with grid-based methods.

name: SciPy
description: Python modules for statistics, optimization, integration, linear algebra, Fourier transforms, signal and image processing, ODE solvers, and more.

name: NumPy
description: Fundamental package needed for scientific computing with Python.

name: FEniCS
description: Open-source computing platform for solving PDEs in Python and C++.

name: libMesh
description: Framework for the numerical simulation of PDEs using arbitrary unstructured discretizations.

name: deal.II
description: Software library supporting the creation of finite element codes.

name: Netgen/NGSolve
description: High performance multiphysics finite element software.

name: Firedrake
description: Automated system for the solution of PDEs using the finite element method.

name: MOOSE
description: Multiphysics Object Oriented Simulation Environment.

name: MFEM
description: Free, lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods.

name: SfePy
description: Simple Finite Elements in Python.

name: FreeFEM
description: High level multiphysics--multimesh finite element language. (C++, LGPL, GitHub)

name: Gmsh
description: Three-dimensional finite element mesh generator with pre- and post-processing facilities.

name: pygmsh
description: Python interface for Gmsh.

name: MeshPy
description: Quality triangular and tetrahedral mesh generation.

name: meshio
description: I/O for various mesh formats, file conversion.

name: CGAL
description: Algorithms for computational geometry.

name: pygalmesh
description: Python interface for CGAL's 3D meshing capabilities.

name: mshr
description: Mesh generation component of FEniCS.

name: MOAB
description: Representing and evaluating mesh data.

name: NetCDF
description: Software libraries and data formats for the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data.

name: HDF5
description: Data model, library, and file format for storing and managing data.

name: XDMF
description: eXtensible Data Model and Format to exchange scientific data between High Performance Computing codes and tools.

name: TetGen
description: Quality tetrahedral mesh generator and 3D Delaunay triangulator.

name: Triangle
description: Two-dimensional quality mesh generator and Delaunay triangulator.

name: optimesh
description: Triangular mesh smoothing.

name: distmesh
description: Simple generator for unstructured triangular and tetrahedral meshes.

name: QuadriFlow
description: A Scalable and Robust Method for Quadrangulation.

name: trimesh
description: Loading and using triangular meshes with an emphasis on watertight surfaces.

name: dmsh
description: Simple generator for unstructured triangular meshes, inspired by distmesh.

name: SuperLU
description: Direct solution of large, sparse, nonsymmetric systems of linear equations.

name: KryPy
description: Krylov subspace methods for the solution of linear algebraic systems.

name: PyAMG
description: Algebraic Multigrid Solvers in Python.

name: FFTW
description: Discrete Fourier transforms in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and of both real and complex data.

name: Qhull
description: Convex hull, Delaunay triangulation, Voronoi diagram, halfspace intersection about a point, furthest-site Delaunay triangulation, and furthest-site Voronoi diagram.

name: GSL
description: Wide range of mathematical routines such as random number generators, special functions, and least-squares fitting.

name: OpenFOAM
description: Free, open source CFD (computational fluid dynamics) software.

name: ParaView
description: Multi-platform data analysis and visualization application based on VTK.

name: quadpy
description: Numerical integration (quadrature, cubature) in Python.

name: FiPy
description: Finite-volume PDF solver.

name: accupy
description: Accurate sums and dot products for Python.

name: SLEPc
description: Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations.

name: Chebfun
description: Computing with functions to about 15-digit accuracy.

name: SciComp StackExchange
description: Computational Science on the StackExchange network.

name: Wolfgang Bangerth's video class
description: MATH 676: Finite element methods in scientific computing.

name: Nick Higham's blog
description: Mostly on MATLAB, general computing advice.

name: Nick Trefethen's Video Lectures
description: 36 video lectures on approximation theory/practice and scientific computing.

name: John D. Cook's blog
description: Feats of scientific computing.

name: Jack Dongarra's software list
description: List of freely available software for the solution of linear algebra problems.
